title: FPS issues after windows 10 update
body:
Hello,

I've noticed that after I get into game (first game of the day) that I will get issues with FPS until I restart my League client. I have followed the sticky about disabling the GAME DVR option on Microsoft but still get the same issue. I usually start the day off with an ARAM just to mitigate the issue of having to do it in a Ranked game. I've tried starting a custom game and logging out and reconnecting but this does not fix the issue, for whatever reason it needs to be a non-custom game. 

Has anyone else troubleshot this issue and been able to fix it? It's tedious to have to play an ARAM just to get the issue to go away safely.

Thanks, 
Flopsies

Edit:// I've now noticed it must be a summoner's rift game, not sure how that helps but I tried relogging an aram and it didn't work.
Edit2: Okay I've downloaded the Hextech repair and used that, as well as repatching. I've also done the compatibility test, and also note that i do play in Windows Borderless mode. We'll see what happens! Appreciate all the support thus far.

Edit3: It's been a few days and for the first time ever, I restarted my client and the ping spikes DIDN'T go away. Usually the restart fixes it. I've ran that "FPS Fix" checklist as well and I have completely uninstalled/reinstalled League - still didn't fix the issue.
I did get "invited" (I think everyone did?) to the League Alpha Client and have only played two games on the Alpha, to which the lag is still there, at this point I have run out of ideas on what to do.

replies.body:
so after win update right ? Did you try to desaible the win10 (ONLY!) xbox game record thing ?
> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=O89HAMWi,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-28T15:39:07.673+0000)
>
> FPS issues like this can be caused by outdated drivers, so updating them was a solid step.  There may be other factors as well, like hardware or bad game files.  There's also been a recent Windows 10 update that auto-enabled the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html), which has been causing fps issues for some players.  Disabling that may the issue fixed!
> 
> Otherwise, check out each step in our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to get that fixed up, and to make sure that your files are tuned up to play.  Let me know if you have any questions!

another thing would be drivers and if it is still happening try to download the hextech repair tool from riot (mine took 1h to download 46,7 mb) Link: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool

EDIT: ok simple fix just try to play in windowed or borlderless mode not in fullscreen
Try running the windows compatibility test that you can access by right clicking the League icon

I appreciate the troubleshooting done so far, and there's still a few things to try.  The game bar was a good step, but you might also have bad drivers or game files causing fps problems too.  I suggest specifically going over every step of the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to rule out possibilities and get things fixed up.  Let me know if you have any questions!
